fact_check_explanation_title: Estimates of heart condition prevalence in the UK isn’t linked to vaccines
fact_check_explanation_summary: A video wrongly implies the results of a new study looking at how many people may need treatment for a heart condition has only appeared since people started getting the …

fact_check_explanation_title: Higher number of reported Covid-19 deaths down to backlog
fact_check_explanation_summary: The unusually high number came from a backlog in the death reporting system. The average number of daily Covid-19 deaths is currently around 243 and falling.

fact_check_explanation_title: Michael Gove incorrect to say 97% of PPE procured 'fit-for-purpose'
fact_check_explanation_summary: Michael Gove claimed 97% of PPE procured was fit-for-purpose and on the front line. In actual fact, while it may have been usable by someone, not all of it was …

fact_check_explanation_title: Government website makes percentage error on National Insurance rise
fact_check_explanation_summary: Multiple government web pages make the technically inaccurate claim that planned National Insurance contributions are going to rise by 1.25%, when it’s actually a percentage point increase.

fact_check_explanation_title: A surgeon made several incorrect claims about Covid-19 vaccine on GB News
fact_check_explanation_summary: Ahmad Malik has misused various different sources to falsely suggest that the vaccines are dangerous.

fact_check_explanation_title: A needle cannot save the life of someone having a stroke
fact_check_explanation_summary: If you think someone is having a stroke, it’s vital you call 999 as soon as possible.

fact_check_explanation_title: What did Boris Johnson tell MPs about the alleged 13 November Downing Street party?
fact_check_explanation_summary: The release of Sue Gray’s report has led to a renewed focus on comments made by the PM in December.

fact_check_explanation_title: Video filmed at police station is filled with Covid-19 vaccine misinformation
fact_check_explanation_summary: A video shared on Facebook of police speaking to vaccine sceptics is littered with unfounded claims about a non-existent investigation into Covid vaccinations.

fact_check_explanation_title: Claims Covid-19 vaccines have led to five times more deaths than other vaccines are based on false assumptions
fact_check_explanation_summary: It has been misleadingly claimed that the UK has recorded five times more deaths ‘due to’ the Covid-19 vaccines than all other vaccines over the past five years.

fact_check_explanation_title: Facebook video on unvaccinated people makes incorrect claims about DNA
fact_check_explanation_summary: The clip claims that Covid-19 vaccines can alter a person’s DNA.

fact_check_explanation_title: Alex Belfield is wrong to say that only 17,500 people died of Covid-19
fact_check_explanation_summary: More than 140,000 people have died of Covid-19 in England and Wales so far.

fact_check_explanation_title: Highway Code changes infographic needs context
fact_check_explanation_summary: An infographic summarising five changes to the Highway Code is largely based in fact but excludes some important context.
